alert.note: Alert for Greenlee (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 22 at 10:26AM MST until August 23 at 9:00AM MST by NWS Tucson
info.description: ...Observed flooding changed to Major severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Arizona... Gila River at Duncan affecting Greenlee County. .Heavy rain has led to a rapid rises on the Gila River. This update includes new data as flood waters have crested at major flood stage on the Gila River at Duncan and are beginning to decrease. For the Upper Gila...including San Carlos Reservoir at Coolidge Dam, Gila River at Calva, Gila River near Solomon, Gila River At Kelvin, Gila River at Duncan...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Major flooding is occurring and will gradually decrease through the day. * WHERE...Gila River at Duncan. * WHEN...Until tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 22.0 feet, Major Flood Stage: Large sections of Duncan flood including business district, residences, and Highway 70. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:30 AM MST Monday the stage was 22.4 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10 AM MST Monday was 22.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected slowly fall, decreasing below flood stage early tomorrow morning. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. - Flood History...No available flood history. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued overnight tomorrow at 300 AM MST.
